channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump offers denial and delusion as pandemic crisis overtakes his presidency
US allies band together against China
He has over 6M TikTok followers. Here's why he is concerned
item.description: TikTok, the popular Chinese app that struck a chord with Gen Z, has found itself navigating tricky political territories. Following India's ban, now the US is also looking to block TikTok citing security concerns. CNN's Hadas Gold reports on the pressure TikTok and its community face.

item.title: Mary Trump's scathing message for the US President
item.description: If Mary Trump were in the Oval Office with her uncle Donald Trump today, she would tell him to resign, she told ABC's George Stephanopoulos in an interview to support her explosive tell-all book about the President.

item.title: Prosecutor investigating couple who brandished guns at protesters says governor and Trump are targeting her
item.description: The office of St. Louis Circuit Attorney Kim Gardner said on Twitter that Missouri's governor and President Donald Trump "came after her" for investigating a case.

item.title: 'Just ludicrous.' Anderson Cooper slams Trump's Covid-19 comments
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper says that President Donald Trump turned a Rose Garden event into a campaign rally and again ignored the coronavirus pandemic while citing a lie about Covid-19 testing.

item.title: 5 takeaways from primary elections and runoffs in Texas, Alabama and Maine
UK's Huawei 5G ban could prompt other nations to follow suit
item.description: The UK's decision to ban Huawei from its 5G networks was a big victory for the Trump administration and could lead to other nations following suit. It also risks a backlash from China. CNN's Sherisse Pham reports.

item.title: The US reports more than 67,000 new cases, highest daily jump so far
Controversial slave trader statue replaced with one of a Black Lives Matter protester
item.description: Last month, Black Lives Matter demonstrators in Bristol, UK, made headlines around the world when they toppled a statue of 17th-century slave trader Edward Colston and dumped it into the River Avon.

item.title: Apple wins appeal against $15 billion EU tax bill
item.description: Apple has won its appeal against a European Commission ruling that it owed Ireland â‚¬13 billion ($14.9 billion) in taxes.

item.title: New York Times moves some staff out of Hong Kong as security law brings media chill
item.description: The New York Times is moving some staff out of Hong Kong due to a new security law imposed by China on the city, as both foreign and local media face increased uncertainty in the Asian financial hub.

item.title: Early trials for coronavirus vaccine show 'promising' results
item.description: A Covid-19 vaccine developed by the biotechnology company Moderna in partnership with the National Institutes of Health has been found to induce immune responses in all of the volunteers who received it in a Phase 1 study.

item.title: As rowdy tourists flout coronavirus laws, residents in some Spanish resorts fear new surge in cases
item.description: Scenes of drunken young tourists cavorting without masks, jumping on cars and chanting aggressively on the streets of a resort town have raised concerns in Spain as the country teeters on the edge of a fresh coronavirus surge.

item.title: Quest took his first flight in months. Here's what he now thinks about aviation's future
item.description: It was my first flight in nearly four months after the longest separation I've had from aviation in 35 or 40 years.

item.title: Huawei's hopes of global domination have been dashed
item.description: Britain's decision to ban Huawei from the country's 5G network is a huge blow to the Chinese conglomerate's global ambitions and hopes of leading the next generation of wireless technology.

item.title: Twitter's rigid fact-check rules allow Trump to continue spreading false information about the election
item.description: The world took notice on May 26, when Twitter fact-checked President Donald Trump for the very first time. Trump posted a series of blatant lies about mail-in voting, and declared that "this will be a rigged election." Twitter responded swiftly, saying that the viral posts contained "potentially misleading" information, and slapped a fact-check label on them.

item.title: US banks warn of much more economic pain ahead
Pakistan wants to win back trust after pilot license scandal
item.description: Pakistan's revelations that a third of its registered pilots were operating on dubious licenses have led to an erosion in its reputation for aviation safety. Now, the country's information minister tells CNN's Richard Quest they'd welcome international help fixing the problem.

item.title: Ivanka Trump campaign tells out-of-work Americans to 'find something new'
item.description: Four months before the presidential election, Ivanka Trump, adviser to her father President Donald Trump, is promoting a new ad campaign dubbed, "Find Something New."

item.title: 'Glee' star Naya Rivera died from drowning, autopsy rules
item.description: An autopsy issued by the Ventura County Medical Examiner's Office has ruled that actress Naya Rivera died as a result of drowning.

item.title: 'Stunning' images emerge from clashes between police and protesters in Jerusalem
item.description: Hundreds gathered on the streets of Jerusalem to call for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to resign. Israel has seen record new Covid-19 cases and the economy has been hit hard by the crisis. CNN's Oren Liebermann reports.

item.title: The world's methane emissions are at a record high, and burping cows are driving the rise
item.description: Methane emissions are at their highest level ever, with agriculture and fossil fuels the biggest drivers, according to new research.

item.title: Judge halts federal execution and orders further evaluation of mental competency claims
item.description: The second federal execution scheduled for this week has been halted by a federal judge out of Washington, DC.

item.title: The handful of countries still welcoming US tourists
item.description: Once one of the world's most powerful travel documents, the might of the US passport has shriveled under the cloud of coronavirus, with doors slammed shut across the planet to American travelers.

item.title: Google joins the dash for India's Jio with $4.5 billion investment
item.description: Asia's richest man is getting another massive investment from Silicon Valley as he grows his technology empire in India.

item.title: Marcus Rashford to be awarded honorary doctorate by University of Manchester
item.description: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is to become the youngest ever recipient of an honorary doctorate from the University of Manchester.

item.title: 11-year-old boy fatally shot while picking up phone charger
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon talks to the grandfather of an 11-year-old boy who was fatally shot.

item.title: He's been working with police to prevent crime for years. His grandson was killed in crossfire this month
item.description: Davon McNeal, an 11-year-old boy in Washington, DC, was getting out of a car to grab phone charger from his aunt's house. As he stepped out, he was caught in the middle of a shooting among a group of men and was killed.

item.title: Chris Cuomo: My 10-year-old knows better than what Trump just said
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo analyzes President Trump's "up-is-down strategy" when fighting the Covid-19 pandemic, and defends Dr. Anthony Fauci from the Trump administration's attacks.

item.title: Top Premier League managers slam 'disgraceful' decision to overturn Manchester City's ban
item.description: The decision to overturn Manchester City's ban from European football competitions has been labeled "disgraceful" and not "a good day for football" by two of the biggest managers in the English Premier League.

item.title: Doctor on dealing with both pandemic and rise in gun violence
item.description: Dr. Brian Williams from the University of Chicago talks to CNN's Don Lemon about what it's like dealing with both the Covid-19 pandemic and the spike in gun violence in the US at the same time.

item.title: 'Dirty Dancing' lake is filling up with water 12 years after it dried up
item.description: In 2008, Mountain Lake, made famous by the 1987 film "Dirty Dancing," dried up and remained that way for over a decade. But this summer, it's starting to fill back up, astonishing both locals and visitors.

item.title: Disneyland Paris reopens with new Covid-19 measures
item.description: Disneyland Paris has been closed for four months but now the European theme park is cautiously reopening to the public, with new measures to try to keep Covid-19 in check.

item.title: From the Midlands to Madrid, the life of trailblazing Black footballer Laurie Cunningham that was ended too soon
item.description: Darren Moore vividly recalls sitting at home as an eight-year-old, staring at the television in wide-eyed amazement.

item.title: Nissan unveils its first electric SUV, the Ariya
item.description: The Nissan Ariya, the company's first all-electric SUV, will be able to drive up to 300 miles on a single charge and features a high-tech interior, with almost no buttons or knobs, according to the automaker.

item.title: A private island off the coast of Ireland just sold for $6 million. The buyer only saw it in a video tour
item.description: A private island off the coast of Ireland boasting three beaches, seven houses and natural wildlife has been sold for more than $6.3 million -- with the anonymous buyer not even visiting the location in person before going through with the purchase.

item.title: Discovering new species in Chilean Patagonia -- before they go extinct
item.description: On the Pacific fringes of Chile lies a biological haven. Along the Patagonian coast, surrounded by majestic snow-capped mountains, corals live among some of the deepest fjords in the world. New species are being discovered here; there are still areas waiting to be documented. But even as the reefs' secrets reveal themselves, there is trouble in paradise.

item.title: Police video captures dramatic rescue of baby girl
item.description: Dashcam video captured a Michigan police officer's dramatic rescue of a 3-week-old girl.

item.title: The Maldives is now open to all global tourists. Here's how they're doing it
item.description: Though border restrictions and quarantine measures are keeping people from visiting many of the world's most popular travel destinations at the moment, one country famed for its natural beauty is now welcoming all guests -- the Maldives.

item.title: Tiger Woods praises Black Lives Matter movement
item.description: Ahead of his first competitive appearance since the death of George Floyd, Tiger Woods has called the Black Lives Matter movement "fantastic."

item.title: Radio host loses show after harassing Spanish-speaking workers
item.description: Dianna Ploss, who had a show on WSMN in New Hampshire, livestreamed the racist incident on Facebook.

item.title: From cheese-rolling to grime: The curious pastimes of the English
item.description: In an old English tradition, believed by some to have pagan origins, the people of Brockworth, Gloucestershire, chase a wheel of cheese down a steep hill on the last Monday of every May. The cheese is taken home by whoever tumbles to the bottom first.

item.title: US allies once seemed cowed by Beijing. Now they're responding with rare coordination
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping surprised the world with a speech at Davos in 2017, defending free trade and joint action on climate change asÂ thenÂ US president-elect Donald Trump argued for precisely the opposite. It might have been anÂ overambitious pitch by Xi to position China as the world's next leader, but itÂ alsoÂ seemed a genuine sign that Beijing was committing to the international rules-based order.Â

item.title: US is treating Hong Kong as mainland China. Business is starting to do the same
item.description: The relationship between China and the West is rapidly eroding, and that could have serious implications for Hong Kong's status as a global financial hub.

item.title: Trump punishes China over Hong Kong
item.description: President Donald Trump plans to address China during afternoon remarks at the White House, officials said.

item.title: Jeff Sessions bet HUGE on Donald Trump -- and lost
item.description: "I leave elective office with my integrity in tact," Jeff Sessions said Tuesday night following his rout at the hands of former Auburn University football coach Tommy Tuberville in a runoff for the Alabama Republican Senate nomination. "This chapter of my life is closed."

item.title: UK will pay hefty price for kicking out Huawei
item.description: â€¢ How much trouble is Huawei in? â€¢ Here's why 5G is the future

item.title: China sanctions Lockheed Martin for Taiwan arms sales
item.description: China said on Tuesday it would place sanctions on Lockheed Martin for its involvement in arms sales to Taiwan, a move that could further escalate tensions between Beijing and Washington.

item.description: â€¢ ANALYSIS: Jeff Sessions bet HUGE on Donald Trump -- and lost â€¢ Vaccine shows 'promising' results â€¢ LIVE: CDC director offers bleak outlook â€¢ The US saw a record number of new Covid-19 cases Tuesday â€¢ See what Trump supporters are saying as pandemic worsens â€¢ Trump's niece calls for him to resign
